intro: Astragalus sungpanensis f. albiflorus, commonly known as the white-flowered milkvetch, is a rare and distinctive plant species native to specific regions of China. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its unique morphological features, including its pale to white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical significance lies in its limited distribution and potential ecological roles within its native habitat. This subspecies is of interest to botanists and conservationists due to its rarity and unique floral characteristics.
